decks.notes: This deck focuses on filling up the graveyard quickly with a variety of self-mill, discard, and sacrifice effects to enable the powerful graveyard synergies of Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis. With an emphasis on aggressive creature plays and reanimation, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a swarm of powerful creatures like Vengevine, Gravecrawler, and Craterhoof Behemoth. The deck also includes strong utility creatures like Fauna Shaman and Eternal Witness to find key pieces and recur important spells. Additionally, there are graveyard recursion spells like Life from the Loam and Reanimate to bring back key creatures or lands. Overall, the strategy revolves around utilizing the graveyard as a resource to power out threats and outvalue opponents.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of hand disruption, removal spells, and graveyard recursion. Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger serves as the commander and is supported by various cards that can disrupt the opponent's hand such as Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. Removal spells like Terminate, Fatal Push, and Dismember help deal with threats on the board. The deck also utilizes graveyard recursion cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring back key creatures. Blood Moon and Magus of the Moon are included to disrupt opponents relying on non-basic lands. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing control and ultimately out-value them.

This deck focuses on a fast-paced, aggressive playstyle utilizing the synergy between the Partner commanders Thrasios and Ludevic. By running a mix of efficient removal spells, counter spells, and creatures with evasion and utility abilities, the deck aims to control the board while applying pressure on the opponent. With a strong mana base and a variety of card draw and manipulation spells, the deck can adapt to different situations and maintain its aggressive strategy throughout the game. By utilizing powerful cards like True-Name Nemesis, Oko, Thief of Crowns, and Lightning Bolt, the deck can quickly overwhelm the opponent and secure victory before they have a chance to recover.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, draw spells, and card advantage engines. With Kess, Dissident Mage as the commander, the deck aims to play a reactive game, disrupting the opponent's strategy while building up its own resources. By leveraging the graveyard with spells like Snapcaster Mage and Mystic Sanctuary, the deck can recycle powerful spells and maintain control over the game. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Ral, Storm Conduit to generate value and close out the game. Overall, the key strategy is to outlast and outmaneuver the opponent until you can secure victory.

The main idea behind this deck is to utilize Karlov of the Ghost Council as an aggressive commander in a Duel Commander 1 vs 1 format. The deck focuses on quickly building up Karlov's counters by gaining life through various means such as lifelink creatures, lifegain enchantments, and spells. Additionally, the deck includes removal spells and disruption to control the board and protect Karlov. The deck also includes cards like Bitterblossom and Curse of the Forsaken to provide a constant source of life gain. Overall, the strategy revolves around quickly growing Karlov, gaining life, and controlling the board to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory through consistent pressure and efficient removal.

The deck focuses on assembling a fast and aggressive Goblin tribal strategy with Grenzo, Dungeon Warden as the commander. Utilizing a mix of low-cost Goblin creatures, anthems like Goblin King and Goblin Chieftain, and powerful support cards like Goblin Matron and Goblin Recruiter, the deck aims to flood the board with threats quickly. The inclusion of cards like Krenko, Tin Street Kingpin and Siege-Gang Commander provide additional token generation and ways to overwhelm the opponent. Additionally, the deck includes disruption in the form of Thoughtseize and Duress to control the opponent's plays. Overall, the key concept is to swarm the battlefield with Goblins, buff them up, and unleash a relentless assault on the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using Radha, Heir to Keld as the commander. The deck is filled with efficient creatures and burn spells to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The mana base is optimized for a fast start and consistent mana production. The key strategy is to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain that pressure throughout the game, using creatures like Goblin Guide and Tarmogoyf, along with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Searing Blaze. The goal is to close out the game as quickly as possible by taking advantage of the deck's aggressive nature and efficient cards.

The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast-paced, aggressive strategy utilizing a combination of red and blue cards. The deck includes a variety of cheap and efficient spells to control the board while dealing steady damage to the opponent. The commanders Kraum and Ludevic provide card draw and additional utility, allowing the deck to maintain its tempo and apply pressure consistently. The creatures in the deck are evasive and have abilities that synergize well with the spells included. Additionally, the deck includes disruption in the form of counterspells and removal, ensuring that the opponent's game plan is constantly disrupted. Overall, the deck seeks to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent through a combination of speed, control, and aggression.
